Two INGO staff were ambushed and kidnapped by unknown gunmen while travelling near Kanyamahoro, 10km north of Goma on the Goma-Kibumba road. Information on their whereabouts is currently unknown.

Two UN staff members and one INGO staff were injured after a group of refugees temporarily took them hostage at a food distribution project in Yusuf Batil and assaulted them. They received minor medical care.
One NGO health worker was assaulted by a People's Militia Force perpetrator with a rifle butt. Reports indicate the aid worker was providing COVID-19 assistance.
Two NNGO staff members were ambushed and kidnapped in Momo, NW, by an unknown armed group over suspicion they were collecting information for the military. They were released after 6 days.
One driver was shot and killed in an INGO contracted convoy after it was attacked by unknown gunmen near Aru junction on the Juba-Nimule road.
One NGO staff member was assaulted after he was stopped on his motorcycle and robbed in Ezo county on the Yambio-Tambura road. He was able to reach a nearby medical centre after the attack.
One NGO staff member was injured after their ambulance was targeting by shelling while they were providing assistance to victims of a previous shelling attack in Hazwan village, Aleppo.
One INGO compound guard was seriously beaten when unknown perpetrators raided the compound in New Fangak. Another guard was able to activate the alarm and nothing was taken before they fled.

The director of an NGO all-girls school in Khoja Lakan, Paghman district was abducted by Taliban militants from his home. He was held for 2 days and tortured in regards to the NGO and his work with the organisation. He was released on August 11. Women's and girl's programs have been suspended indefinitely.
One UN agency contracted compound guard was shot and killed by unknown gunmen in Bentiu.
One NGO driver was kidnapped by unknown gunmen in the village of Bambara Maoude, Tombouctou.

One NGO staff member was kidnapped during an armed group attack in Nyiragongo that killed 4 civilians and led to 7 other civilian abductions (not counted here). The whereabouts of the staff is presently unknown.
One UN national staff member on a motorbike was injured after he was assaulted during a road robbery in N'djamena.
Two national partners of an INGO were abducted by unknown actors from a public bus in Batagarawa, Katsina. Their whereabouts remain unknown.
One international ICRC staff was killed in an attack in Bamenda, Northwest.
One UN staff member was badly beaten on his way home from work after running into a gang fight in Dire town.

At least two NGO health workers were reportedly abducted from the Lasu Refugee Camp after an unknown armed group raided the camp, stole items from the facility, damaged an ambulance, and abducted other residents.
One NGO male staff member was beaten in the head after being arrested by the military for political Facebook posts in Min Taing Pin.
One national UN staff was assaulted and injured by unknown criminals in Kampala.
One female INGO staff member was shot and killed by a stray bullet while in her car on the road during the Kabul Airport complex IS terrorist attack.

One INGO national male staff member was killed in a United States military drone strike in Kabul, when the aerial bombardment targetted his home. Media reports indicate the staff member's vehicle was targeted as it arrived home on the suspicion the water containers it was carrying were explosives. 9 other civilians were killed, including 7 children.
One INGO national aid worker was killed during a Boko Haram raid into the military compound in Rann, Borno. 16 other civilians were killed (not counted here).
One NGO chairman was shot and killed after members of the pro-military Pyu Saw Htee militia fired shots at his home in Chaung Daung village.
One INGO national staff member was attacked and stabbed by unknown perpetrators outside his home in Nhlangano.
One INGO staff member's throat was cut by an unknown intruder in his home at night. The staff member survived.
One NGO staff member was kidnapped from his home in Shnan, Idlib by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham. He was held and tortured until November 20, 2021.
One NGO staff member was reportedly killed in crossfire during community clashes in Tombura town.
Four NGO staff members providing COVID-19 medical support in Thayetchaung town, Tanintharyi, were kidnapped by an unknown armed group. Their whereabouts is currently unknown.

An INGO vehicle on route from Paoua to Bocaranga hit an IED near Koupala, killing the driver and wounding 2 other staff members. Reports indicate the IED was planted by the Retour, Reclamation et Rehabilitation (3R) armed group.

One INGO staff member was kidnapped from the INGO health clinic 38km SW of Bankass by unknown armed elements, for allegedly not informing the group of their presence in the area. The staff was released 5 days later.
One NGO staff member was reportedly kidnapped travelling between Fada Ngourma and Kikideni. They were released on September 18 2021.
One INGO national staff manager was shot and killed outside his home in the capital.
An aid worker was killed after being reportedly arrested and detained by the military and police, with another civilian (not counted here), in Twantay township, Yangon.
One UN contracted male daily worker was injured after being assaulted by 6 unknown armed men on his way to work in Bor town.
Three staff members from a UN agency NGO implementing partner were shot and wounded after their aid convoy was ambushed by unknown gunmen near Buhumba village, Nyiragongo.
One NGO staff member was shot and injured by an unknown armed group after he was returning from bringing a landmine victim to the nearby hospital.

A UN agency NGO implementing partner aid convoy was ambushed 30km from Yei on the Yei-Kaya road near Ligi, by an unknown armed group. The driver was killed, one staff was injured, and the other 3 were kidnapped. Their whereabouts is unknown.
One NGO staff member was shot and killed during an ambush and motorcycle theft by JNIM militia members in Tila, Bandiagara.
One UN agency male staff member was kidnapped and interrogated by unknown armed men in Herat city. He was released the following day.
One UN female staff member was injured after an unknown criminal tried to steal her purse while she was riding a motorbike.
One international UN staff member was injured after being assaulted by a UN contractor over payment issues in Malakal.
One INGO security guard was injured after he was assaulted during a criminal raid on a health facility project site in Nyamlel, Aweil West. There was a temporary program suspension.
One aid worker was reportedly arrested on October 2 by the military and died in custody on October 3. Further information is unknown at this time.

One international and one national UN contractor was shot and wounded when their UN contracted barge came under fire from unknown gunmen when travelling between Gakdon and Dengjok in Akobo. The barge had just delivered food and was returning from the contracted mission.
An INGO national staff in Pigi county was shot and killed after being caught in fighting between SPLA IO factions.
One INGO staff member was killed after he was ambushed on the road linking Aden and Lahj while travelling for personal business. Their belongings were also stolen.
One NGO staff member was reportedly arrested by Junta Forces in central Yangon, Hlegu township, seriously tortured, then shot and killed.
Three INGO staff members were kidnapped by suspected Mai Mai militia members while travelling 119km south of Uvira, Fizi district for ransom. They were freed on October 9.
Two humanitarian staff members were kidnapped in Bouca, Ouham for 2 days.
One INGO staff member was shot and killed in an armed robbery where his motorcycle was stolen in Sevare, Mopti.
Four NGO staff members were ambushed and kidnapped in Kingarame, North Kivu.
Two NGO staff members were reportedly kidnapped with their vehicle in Niono, Segou.

One UN national staff member was reportedly ambushed by unknown gunmen along the Juba-Nimule road in Maqwi county. Some reports indicate the staff member managed to escape the attack, but no communication has been received from the staff member.
A charity worker with an oxygen cylinder business was shot and killed by unknown gunmen in Taze town.
One NGO staff member was reportedly kidnapped in Borno and reports indicate ISWA has taken responsibility.
One INGO male staff was killed in his home in Yei town. Further information is unavailable at this time.
One NGO driver was injured in the thigh and arm after unknown criminals fired shots at the organisation's vehicle leaving the Goudebo refugee camp, 14km outside of Dori.

12 (5 men, 7 women) international staff members of a Christian INGO were kidnapped by the criminal group 400 Mawozo in Croix des Bouquets, 13 km northeast of Port au Prince, while on route from an orphanage visit. They were all released by December 20, 2021.
One male INGO national staff member was shot and killed in Bunia for unknown reasons.
One INGO male national staff member was killed when his car hit a landmine in the Al-Qasar roundabout in Salah, Taiz.
One NGO staff member was shot and killed by a militia member after refusing a food ration card the perpetrator was not entitled to.
Two INGO staff contracted to operate a cash distribution site in Kaya Refugee Camp were assaulted and injured by refugees upset with the speed of the distribution.

One INGO staff member was shot and injured after an intoxicated man entered a public market area in Lasu refugee camp, begun demanding money and then opened fire. One other civilian (not counted here) was killed.

Two ICRC staff were reportedly peppered sprayed by Israeli settlers in Burin, Nablus, during a joint field visit with Palestinian farmers and IDF officials. The staff received medical attention at the military base.
Two INGO staff members were shot and wounded when their organisation vehicle was ambushed while travelling between Kobu and Bambu, Ituri, by unknown armed individuals for unknown reasons.
One NGO staff member was one of 10 civilians killed in community clashes in Gakdong, Akobo county.
2 NGO staff members were injured after a landmine on the road in Lower Dhak, Kolyan exploded.
One INGO aid worker was kidnapped by unknown actors while waiting for a colleague to do carpooling. The aid worker was released after a ransom was paid.

One aid worker, helping residents of the IDP camp, was reportedly arrested my military personnel in the camp in Pekon township, Shan. Reports indicate he later died in military custody due to injuries consistent with torture.
Two INGO staff members were kidnapped by armed group members while travelling in the Sahel region. They were released on December 19, 2021.
One NGO driver was detained for one day after his vehicle was stopped at an SPLO-IO checkpoint in Bagari Payam. The vehicle was not released until November 21.
One UN agency staff member was assaulted and injured by a group from a labour union who came to the UN warehouse in Cox's Bazar and threatened to stop activities.
Two INGO staff and a guard were injured after unknown armed men raided the organisation compound and stole money at gunpoint.
One NGO male staff member was seriously beaten at a checkpoint in Sosa town by SDF forces.
Three INGO national staff members were injured by the Armed Forces during the raid of a private residence in Yangon.
One guard was injured by unknown armed men who raided the organisation compound and stole a vehicle in Ed Daien.
One UN national staff was shot and wounded by Mai Mai militia in Lambo Katenga, Kalemie.

One INGO staff member was injured after the organisation supported health centre in Foube, Sanmatenga was burned down by unknown armed perpetrators. Official reports indicate it was likely collateral damage after the initial attack targeted a nearby police station.
One INGO male staff was shot and injured by a man in a military uniform who robbed him in Adama city.
Two ICRC staff, one national and one international, were kidnapped in Masisi on November 30 by unknown gunmen and released on December 11.
One UN female staff was robbed and stabbed on the hand by an unknown criminal as she was walking to work in Entebbe.

Two private truck staff contracted to deliver humanitarian supplies to Bibokoboko, Fizi, were shot and killed when their truck was ambushed by unknown armed men. 2 other civilian passengers were also killed (not counted here).
One INGO national staff member was killed after being caught in community violence between armed youths and others in Leer.

Humanitarian staff were reportedly kidnapped along with 6 civil servants and other civilians after departing Damboa, Borno. The exact number of humanitarian staff kidnapped is unknown at this time (coded as two).
One NGO staff member was killed after his vehicle was ambushed in Tile village, Mopti.
The head of an NGO offering ambulance services in Chanmyathazi, Mandalay was shot in a tea shop by unknown perpetrators. He later recovered in hospital.
One INGO driver was kidnapped along with his vehicle, he was released after several days but the unknown armed group kept the vehicle.
One NGO staff member was shot and killed and another was wounded by unknown armed criminals after their motorcycle was ambushed in Tranamaro commune.
One INGO staff was kidnapped by unknown armed men in a public location in Jarabulus, Aleppo. He was held for 2 days. Reports indicate he had previously received threats about recruitment issues.
Three UN agency staff members were wounded after their convoy came under armed attack by suspected Mai Mai militia members while travelling 17km south of Lubero.
One NGO staff member was killed by a family member in an interpersonal dispute in Aweil town.
One UN Agency contracted truck staff was injured when the vehicle hit an IED 78km southwest of Paoua near Ngoutere.
One NGO staff member was killed in a clash between opposing youths in Kong Kong Payam, Jonglei on his way home from work.
One UN agency national staff member was killed in an airstrike in Tigray while off-duty and driving to visit his family.
One UN agency staff was killed and another injured after their convoy was ambushed by unknown armed men between Duk Padiet and Tindiir, Jonglei.
One UN staff member was stabbed by an unknown perpetrator in La Paz outside of his house.
One INGO staff member was assaulted and injured by a community member after he was not picked to be on a committee in Darherate Albakri, Radfan.

Three NGO contracted truck staff were reported missing on December 19 and found dead the following day in a forest outside Batangafo. Perpetrators and cause of death is unknown at this time, but their trucks were looted.

Two INGO national staff members were among the dead in a military massacre in Mo So village, Kayah state. The staff members were returning from an aid mission in a marked INGO vehicle when they were ambushed in the village by Myanmar Armed Forces. Media and official reports indicate at least 35 burned bodies were found in the village, including the two aid workers.
One INGO male staff was stabbed during a robbery in Jawzjan.
One INGO international staff member was kidnapped from his home in Ansongo, Goa. They were released several days later.
One NGO staff member was kidnapped by unknown perpetrators and later released on January 3, 2022.
One male UN national staff was kidnapped by a criminal gang and released after 1 day.
One INGO national staff member was assaulted and injured by a group of community youths over an age set dispute. The staff was evacuated to Juba for medical treatment.
One INGO staff member was beaten by other employees at his home in Pibor for not adhering to age set customs.
One INGO aid worker was racially attacked by unknown people in Warsaw.
One INGO staff was forcibly taken, detained and beaten by the Russian Armed Forces in Ukraine, being accused of espionage.
One INGO staff was injured by gang members in need of medical treatment in Beirut.
One INGO staff was assaulted by unknown men in Mbere, Adamawa.
One volunteer health worker was arrested by SAC forces and later died in detention.
One female NGO staff was shot and injured in an attempted robbery on her house by unknown criminals in Guolpiny village, Koch.
Three INGO staff members were kidnapped by unknown armed perpetrators on the Goma-Kitchanga road in Masisi territory. They were released on January 12.
One national INGO staff was kidnapped, robbed and sexually assaulted in Honduras.
One NGO staff member was shot and killed inside the organisation medical centre in Al-Hawl refugee camp, by suspected Islamic State gunmen.
One INGO male staff member was kidnapped in Menaka Gao on January 11, and escaped his captors on January 13.
One UN humanitarian agency staff member driving a vehicle in Mogadishu was injured after a VBIED targeting a nearby convoy exploded.
One international INGO doctor was stabbed in an ICRC hospital in the Al-Hawl refugee camp, by an unknown perpetrator.
One national female UN aid worker was sexually assaulted by a taxi driver while commuting to work in Kabul.

The president of an NGO was kidnapped while travelling from Abuja to Kaduna near between the villages Akilbu and Rijana. He was reportedly kidnapped and tortured due to his work with some politicians, and released the following week.
5 NGO staff members working bear Oursi town, were kidnapped by ISWA militants. 4 were released later that day (not counted here) and 1 continued to be held. Their whereabouts are unknown.
Two youth NGO assistants in a camp for IDPs were killed in a military airstrike that hit the camp in Nan Mei Khon town Kayah state.
One national male INGO worker was injured by a hand grenade attack in Mogadishu.
One male humanitarian working to set up tents in the Al-Hawl Refugee Camp was shot and killed by suspected Islamic State militants active in the camp.
One female INGO aid worker was sexually harassed by a civilian in Juba.
One INGO staff member was injured when a group of angry commercial motorcyclists threw stones at the INGO vehicle in Katoto centre, Ituri.
Three INGO staff members were kidnapped near Nchowe village, Fizi. Their whereabouts are unknown.
One male NGO staff member was reportedly kidnapped by JNIM militia on the road between Fada NGourma and Pama, Gourma.
Two national male UN aid workers were abducted by unknown armed men in Tabarre 43, close to Port au Prince. The aid workers were released on February 10th.
One male INGO national staff was beaten and injured in the street by a civilian in Menaka, Gao.
One off-duty NGO guard was shot and killed in a suspected revenge killing incident between clans as he was repairing his home in Walgak, Akobo.
Two INGO staff members were reportedly kidnapped by unknown armed extremists while travelling between Bandiagara and Sevare, Mopti. There whereabouts is currently unknown.
One NGO staff member was killed while extinguishing a fire in Idlib.

6 NGO staff members (4 male and 2 female) operating a women's program, were attacked by radical Union Parishad supporters who demanded the staff stop all humanitarian programs in the area. All 6 staff members were transported to the hospital and received medical care.
One NGO staff member was reportedly stabbed by suspected gang members in Hai Joppa, Juba city.
Four male and one female INGO national staff were kidnapped for several days by an unknown armed group in Mali.
One INGO nurse was killed and two other NGO staff injured in inter-communal fighting in Agok, Rumamer county, Abyei.
One INGO staff was killed in crossfire during inter-communal fighting in Mir Mir, Unity.
Three NGO staff members were injured after they were attacked by unknown gunmen on the road near MirMir.
One international and four national UN aid workers were abducted by al-Qaeda militants in Abyan, Southern Yemen. The five aid workers were released and walked free on August 11th, 2023.
One INGO staff member was killed during by crossfire in Leer, Unity.
One international UN agency male staff member was killed in a violent robbery in Nairobi.
One NGO staff driver was reportedly shot and killed on his way to the office by unknown perpetrators, some reports indicate it may be related to a personal dispute.
One national man UN staff member was abducted by unknown armed men in Vivy Mitchell, Port au Prince. The aid worker managed to escape on February 23rd.
One UN contracted truck driver was ambushed and assaulted by suspected Murle Tribesmen who robbed him, on the Bor-Gadiang road.
Two INGO national aid workers were injured during a robbery by criminals in their home in Gao.
One UN agency staff member was shot and injured during a failed robbery of his home in Fayzabad. He was transferred to Kabul and recovered.

Two national male INGO aid workers were kidnapped by unknown armed men who asked them what were they doing in the zone and who gave them permission to enter. The aid workers were released on February 26.
One male NGO staff member was robbed and killed in Uvira at a transfer shop, some reports indicate the staff may have been in debt to the shop but the motive is unknown.
4 polio vaccinators were killed in Kundoz city by an unknown armed group.
Three female polio vaccinators were shot and killed in Imam Sahib by unknown armed individuals.
One male polio vaccinator was shot and killed in Taloqan, Takhar by unknown gunmen.
Five INGO staff members were kidnapped from the organisation residence in Fotokol town, Far North region.
One INGO staff member was killed and two others injured after airstrikes hit the town of Thar Yat while the aid workers were assisting to evacuate residents.

One male international INGO aid worker was mistreated and injured while being detained by the Government of the Islamic Republic of Iran due to an accusation of espionage. The aid worker was released on May 26th of 2023.
One male national INGO staff was kidnapped for 24h and beaten by an unidentified armed group in Port au Prince.
One national INGO staff was injured by a beneficiary in Deir Hassan, Idlib. The team had to suspend the program for two days.
A UN contracted truck hit an IED between Bocaranga and Bozoum injuring one staff and killing another.
Two INGO international staff were kidnapped when their vehicle was ambushed near Khoshm Alain, Al Abr district. They were released on September 13, 2022.
One off-duty aid worker was killed along with 10 other civilians in the Seleia area of West Darfur by the armed Rizeigat Militia.
One INGO national staff driver was shot in the leg after his vehicle was ambushed by unknown armed men 15km east of Kapoeta.
One INGO staff member was killed and one other injured after mortar strikes hit Sung Du La village while the aid workers were assisting in the evacuation of residents.
One NGO female staff member was shot and killed in her vehicle as her and her family attempted to evacuate from Kiev.
Two INGO-funded security guards were abducted by unknown actors in Kumalia, Borno state. One of them died in custody, while the other managed to escape on July 27, 2022.

City: Between Lambo Katenga and Kasongo Mukuli
Details: Six national male UN-contracted aid workers were abducted by Mai Mai militants around 4 kilometers from Lambo Katenga-Kasongo Mukuli road, where they were conducting a project.
One national UN-contracted truck driver was kidnapped during an ambush in Mezam. The food items were distributed to the local population by NSAGs while the driver was released the day after.
Four male nurses and an NGO driver were kidnapped by suspected Mai Mai militia members from a health centre in Katalukulu, Fizi. There whereabouts is unknown.
One off duty NGO staff was reportedly shot and killed in Hiyala, Torit for unknown reasons.
One NGO staff member and two guards were kidnapped during a raid on their compound. The three aid workers were released on August 31.
One national male UN-contracted aid worker was beaten and injured by an unknown aid recipient in POC Camp, Malakal.
Two INGO staff members were killed when a Russian tank shelled a building in the centre of Mariupol housing the INGO office.
One female paramedic aid worker was kidnapped by Russian forces in Donbas. The aid worker was released on June 17, 2022.
One UN-contracted driver assistant was shot dead during an ambush on food commodities traveling from Ag Geneina to Mukjar, West Darfur.
One national male UN worker was physically assaulted and injured while exercising in a public venue in Mavalane, Maputo. Some personal belongings were stolen.
One female INGO aid worker was kidnapped by the Russian Armed Forces in Orlovskoe, Luhansk. Her whereabouts are currently unknown.
A truck contracted by an NGO to transport materials to Lankien was ambushed by unknown gunmen and one of the foreign national staff was shot and killed.
An aid worker was shot and arrested during a military operation, and later died in custody.
The head of a local NGO was shot and killed when the military raided their office inside a monastery in Myo Kone village, Yangon.

11 aid truck drivers and 4 other aid workers were reportedly ambushed by Russian Armed Forces as they approached the besieged city of Mariupol, halting the aid convoy. Government reports explain the 15 aid workers were kidnapped by the invading forces and their whereabouts is currently unknown.

One male national UN staff sustained major injuries during an explosion in the Lamagalay administration area in Beledweyne, targeting government and security personnel. Another UN staff, 20 security forces personnel, 14 civilians, and one AMISOM soldier also sustained injuries (not counted).

One UN male driver and his assistant were kidnapped by unknown armed elements when transporting food items along the Kongoussi-Bourzanga axis in Bam. Both workers were released 14 days after, whereas the truck was used by armed men to conduct an attack on a police checkpoint near Kongoussi.

Two UN agency contracted staff were killed and another staff was injured after their aid convoy of 17 trucks was ambushed by unknown armed perpetrators between Gadiang and Yuai in Uror county. Two other passengers who were onboard the trucks were killed too (not counted).

Four aid workers were killed, and three more were injured in a Russian shelling of a clinic that was acting as a centre for humanitarian aid in Kharkiv. During the attack, multiple rockets hit the civil infrastructure.
A large aid vehicle convoy was hit by Russian shelling in Chernihiv, killing a female aid worker and injuring 4 other volunteer aid workers.
One INGO health worker was shot and injured when the Myanmar Armed Forces fired at the ambulance they were traveling in.
One INGO security guard was beaten by six unidentified persons armed with AK-47 rifles who broke into an INGO compound and robbed three mobile phones, money, food, and medical supplies.
One national UN-contracted driver was injured with knives by a gang-armed group between Kinshasa and Kikwit.
One male national INGO staff member was injured by a government mortar, captured, and then tortured to death.
Three aid workers from a humanitarian centre in Berdiansk were kidnapped by Russian Armed Forces after an hours long blockade of the centre. Further information is unknown at this time.

Actor name: Unite pour la paix en Centrafrique (UPC)
Details: An INGO convoy was ambushed between Alindao and Bambari by the UPC armed group. The staff members were robbed and 5 were injured (1 critically).
Two NGO staff members were injured after their convoy was attacked and robbed travelling between Alindao and Bambari, by unknown gunmen.
One male international UN staff was injured when unknown armed men entered his house and threatened him while asking for another person. The perpetrators took the staff's personal belongings.
9 NGO minibus drivers attempting to enter the city of Mairupol for evacuations, were reportedly kidnapped and taken by Russian Armed Forces for refusing to facilitate evacuation into Russia.
One INGO staff member was killed in suspected intercommunal violence that took place in Leer country during April 8-11.
One male national INGO staff member was killed by a government artillery round in Kayah.

Four national male UN-contracted personnel were abducted after returning from a food distribution by unknown armed men in Batibo, Momo division, Northwest. The personnel was released two days later, but the vehicle was kept by NSAG elements. After a high-level negotiation, the vehicle was released on May 12.
One humanitarian worker was killed and another injured by Russian shelling in Lysychansk, Luhansk.
One INGO driver was kidnapped along with his vehicle by unknown gunmen in Al Madaribah Wa Al Arah district, Al Hajar village.
Three national NGO workers were injured by shelling while searching for a missing person in Jarabulus, Aleppo.
Three INGO staff were injured after their vehicle was ambushed and robbed on the Batangafo-Ouandago axis.
Two health workers were shot and killed in an INGO-supported hospital by unknown armed elements who raided the health centre in Kereneik.
One Sudanese Red Crescent Society volunteer was killed while on duty in Kereneik camp (80 Km eastern to Al Geneina) during clashes in West Darfur.
One UN agency truck driver assistant was beaten with a rifle after his truck was ambushed between Lohutok and Ibahure, Lafon county.

Four NGO staff members were killed during an attack by Arab Tribesmen in Kereneik town. Reports indicate a hospital, nutrition centre, and other infasturcture was looted, as well as other civilians killed.
Two aid workers were kidnapped by gunmen from a compound. One was freed the following day.
One INGO national staff was kidnapped in Petionville, Port au Prince by unknown perpetrators and held for 2 weeks.
One INGO aid worker was kidnapped, along with their laptops, from their office in the Al-Hawl Refugee Camp by Islamic State militants. Their whereabouts are currently unknown.

Two INGO staff members were kidnapped and another staff member was injured by unknown armed elements while traveling in Kimoka village (2km north of Sake). The two staff were released on the 19 of May.
One INGO national staff was injured after being hit by a stone from an aid recipient in Al Resala IDP Camp, Aleppo. The incident caused a temporary suspension of the program.
9 INGO staff members were kidnapped by unknown armed elements in Kolima, Segou. They were released after 31 hours.

One Red Cross staff member was killed with other civilians by suspected Islamic State militants in the Gadobo-Sangara axis, Tillaberi. The aid worker was not wearing a Red Cross jacket, so the killing was allegedly incidental.

Two INGO staff members were kidnapped with their vehicle while travelling in Omo village, 15km NE of Koro. They were released twelve days later. Six other aid workers were also abducted and released on the same day (not counted).
Three aid workers were kidnapped when the NGO vehicle they were traveling in was ambushed and robbed by armed perpetrators.
One off-duty INGO national aid worker on a motorcycle was attacked by stones thrown by three individuals in an attempted robbery. The victim later died in hospital.
Two INGO staff were kidnapped 7km from Tonka town by unknown armed individuals. The passenger was released after one day and the driver remained in captivity.
One INGO driver was shot by gunmen in a vehicle ambush in Ma'rib.
One national aid worker died from a bullet injury during crossfire as he drove his personal vehicle.
One INGO national staff member was shot and killed in his home by a member of the armed forces in Moyenne-Sido, Ouham.
One NGO staff member was robbed and injured after him and his colleague were ambushed by unknown armed individuals near Kakobo village, Ouham.
One INGO national staff was injured after being hitten by an aid recipient in Ilaf 2 IDP Camp, Aleppo.

Two Red Cross staff members (Malian and Dutch Societies) were shot and killed in an ambush by an unknown armed group near Kayes. The aid workers were travelling in a clearly marked humanitarian organisation vehicle.
One national INGO partner staff was murdered in Cte d'Ivoire.
One NGO staff member was reportedly killed in a suspected revenge attack in Duk Pagaak.
One national INGO aid worker was kidnapped by unknown actors in Delmas, West region. A family member of the aid worker were also kidnapped (not counted). Their whereabouts remain unknown.
One male UN national staff was shot and killed while riding his motorcycle to work in Mawlamyine, Mon state. Perpetrators are unknown at this time.
One national INGO contracted female worker was injured when a complaint from a beneficiary escalated into physical aggression in WOK camp, Al-Hasakah.
One NGO emergency vehicle was reportedly shot at by intoxicated military officers in Ga Po village, Kyaikto township. The driver was killed and another volunteer wounded.
One Kurdistan Red Crescent staff member was kidnapped by unknown armed individuals in the Al-Hawl Refugee Camp. Their whereabouts is unknown.
One INGO aid worker was shot and wounded by the Haitian National Police after refusing to stop at an unmarked checkpoint. The aid worker thought it was a kidnapping attempt.
One senior UN national staff member was killed by an IED on his way to work in Al Bab.
Two INGO aid workers were kidnapped by armed individuals in a vehicle ambush in the Al Hodeidah governorate.

Three humanitarian workers were reportedly kidnapped from an organisation compound in Gana Ari, Monguno. ISWA militants raided the village and killed 16 civilians in the community (not counted here) before kidnapping the staff.

Actor name: Unite pour la Paix en Centrafique (UPC)
Details: Three INGO staff members were ambushed and kidnapped 65 km west of Obo by UPC militants. Ransom was requested and they were released the following day.
One INGO staff member was kidnapped by an unknown armed group and interrogated about the operations of the INGO. He was released the following day.
One NGO female staff member working at a school in the refugee camp was reportedly seriously injured by an intoxicated perpetrator who stabbed her.
One NGO staff member was injured at a checkpoint when an official held up a rope that got tangled in the staff members motorcycle. He was also allegedly assaulted.

One female UN staff member was injured after an unknown man on a motorbike sprayed a liquid on her face while she was walking home from work. The staff suffered burning eyes, headache and nausea from the liquid. Reports suggest it was likely a failed robbery or sexual assault.
One INGO staff member was killed and another injured after airstrikes hit a clinic, rice house, and a classroom in Mutraw, Kayin.
Seven members of a demining team were injured when an IED detonated under the vehicle they were traveling in.
An aid worker was injured with a machete by armed individuals who broke into his home and stole mobile phones, three televisions, and money.
Two NGO staff members were kidnapped in Minga payam by an unknown group. They were released on July 25, 2022.
One INGO staff member was shot and injured after his civilian vehicle was caught in an armed attack as it left Kidal town.
One male INGO staff member was killed in a mortar shelling while providing medical treatment to wounded casualties in Kayah.
The body of an aid worker was found in Al-Hawl camp.
One INGO aid worker was kidnapped by members of the 400 Mawozo while using a car in Croix des Bouquets, West. The family of the staff member were negotiating the ransom.

One national INGO bodyguard died of a heart attack occasionated by the impact of the attack of an unknown group in Barsalogho. During the attack, five civilians were killed and eight militaries were injured. Military equipment was stolen.
One female national UN aid worker was hit by a rubber bullet while waiting at the stop for public transportation.
One national INGO aid worker was ambushed and kidnapped when going from home to work. The whereabouts remain unknown.
Two male NGO staff members were kidnapped by an unknown armed group while carrying out a humanitarian assessment 240km NE of Yambio in Mundri East county. Their whereabouts are currently unknown.
One INGO national staff was reportedly shot and injured by his girlfriend in Pibor.
One NGO staff member was kidnapped by an unknown armed group while travelling in East Wellega. His whereabouts is currently unknown.

One NGO staff was injured in an incident after a regular forces staff member was shot and killed in a community in Ikotos county. Prison forces responded to the incident and killed 2 people in the community and injured the NGO staff.
One NGO male staff member was stabbed to death in his office by another man working in the office. Motive is unknown at this time.
One national male UN aid worker was assaulted and injured by a group of suspected bandits in Gambella town on his way home. Personal belongings were stolen.
Two INGO aid workers were injured at their home by unknown actors due to personal matters in the West Region.
One INGO staff was severely beaten by a bodyguard of the administrative authority in Mutshasha.

Two INGO aid workers were ambushed by around five armed men on their way to Port au Prince airport. One of the aid workers was released on August 8, and the other on August 11 after ransoms were paid.

10 INGO local volunteers were kidnapped by the Russian military while evacuating civilians from Mariupol and held for one week before being released. Reports indicate they were also physically abused during detention.
An INGO driver was kidnapped by criminals while he had stopped on the side of the road to take a call in West department.
One NGO staff member was shot and killed by the police because he was approaching the police station at night in Lamaing town.
One male Red Cross staff member was reportedly kidnapped by a vehicle with the Kachin Independence Army logo on it in Hpakan town. His whereabouts are unknown.
One driver and one driver assistant were shot and wounded by unknown armed men in Eastern Equatoria.

One INGO staff member was stabbed to death in Kabul in August (exact date unknown). Reports indicate a week before his death he received threatening phone calls related to his work with foreign organisations.

One INGO health worker was kidnapped by the Islamic State in West Africa (ISWA) in Abadam LGA. On the 31st of December 2022, the aid worker and three other captives escaped during fighting between ISWA and Boko Haram militants.
One male national INGO off-duty aid worker was beaten and injured at a checkpoint by unknown actors in Deir ez-Zor.
An NGO convoy was shot at by suspected ISWA militants, injuring one aid worker in Diffa.
Two INGO national staff members were killed after their vehicle was ambushed by unknown armed individuals while travelling between Ikotos and Tsertenya.

Two national male UN-contracted personnel were ambushed by unknown armed men while transporting food to Dori, in Centre North. The NSAG elements said that the type of food in the truck is unavailable in the market. Both aid workers were released two days after.
Five humanitarian health workers were reportedly detained for more than 24 hours by a Kitgwang armed faction in Ngony, Koch. The exact release information is unknown at this time.
One INGO aid worker was abducted by unknown actors in Mbiakong village, Uruan, Akwa Ibom state. The aid worker was released on August 30.
Five NGO staff members were reportedly kidnapped along with their vehicle by IS militants near Waliabon village, Ayerou. They were released December 2022.

Four male NGO staff members were shot and killed while travelling between Indaw and Katha towns. They initially went missing on August 22, and their bodies were found on September 14. A local defence force has claimed responsibility citing accusations they were military informants.
One international UN staff was injured when an unknown man entered his house and robbed his personal belongings at night in Tunis, Tunisia.
One NGO ambulance driver was shot and killed by two unknown armed men in Pu Gaw Zun village.

One national NGO volunteer was arrested by members of the Military Police, which is affiliated with the Syrian National Armys Chiefs of Staff, at his place of work at the NGO center in Al-Bab city center, Aleppo governorate. His whereabouts remain unknown.
One UN truck driver was shot and wounded in the hand on the Zamzam-Nyala road, close to the Zamzam IDP camp while transporting aid.

At least 2 drivers from an NGO were beaten by 14 Tribemens in the Koh Sulaiman area of Dera Ghazi Khan district. The aid workers were transporting aid for flood affected people, when they were attacked for not stopping the trucks. Reports also indicate some of the relief items were stolen.
One NGO staff member, after withdrawing a large amount of cash, was attacked in his home by unknown men. He was robbed and later thrown in a nearby well.
14 aid workers were killed in an aid convoy of 7 trucks carrying food, by Al Shabaab militants, on the road between Mahas and Beledweyne districts, Hiraan region. All the trucks were burned.
The body of one Red Cross staff member was found in the Mekima forest a 1 hour walk south of Bango village, Mambasa. Reports indicate he was beheaded by the ADF rebel group.
One NGO ambulance driver and his assistant were injured after their vehicle hit a mine in Thambyuzayat, Mon state, while transporting a passenger.
One NGO staff member was shot and killed walking between work locations by suspected Murle Tribesman. Motive is unknown at this time.
One national contracted bodyguard was assaulted and injured by a non-state armed group in Bangladesh.

Four national male UN-contracted were abducted by armed men when transporting food from Kaya to Dori, Sanmatenga. The two drivers and their assistants were stopped at an illegal checkpoint and taken to an unknown location and the food items were offloaded from the trucks. The personnel were released four days later.
One INGO aid worker was abducted and tortured by unknown actors when entering the compound he lives in in Gusau,  Zamfara state. The perpetrators asked for a ransom to liberate the aid worker.
One female national UN staff was assaulted and injured in her face when a man with a machete robbed her personal belongings when coming home at night in Pemba, Cabo Delgado.

One UN agency staff administering polio vaccines was shot and killed in a camp near Bentiu town as he conducted visits to the health sites. Reports indicate the shooting was due to a territorial revenge dispute.

City: Between Chieng Kuol and Chieng Yaar
Details: One NGO staff member was killed after being shot in crossfire during intercommunal fighting between Chieng Koul and Chieng Yaar communities.
One UN contracted driver delivering aid was injured after his truck was hit with debris following an airstrike in Zana, Tigray.

Actor name: Chieng Kuol and Chieng Yaar communities
Details: One male national UN bodyguard was killed at the warehouse during an intercommunal fight between Chieng Kuol and Chieng Yaar communities. Five other people were also killed (not counted).
One male national INGO aid worker was robbed and beaten outside the office gate in Port au Prince.
One national INGO female aid worker was seriously injured during a bombardment by the Russian Armed Forces in Kiev.
One NGO staff member was injured in an RPG attack while completing project activities in Geldheere village, near Baidoa town, Bay.
One national INGO aid worker was shot and killed by the Uganda People's Defence Force while riding a motorcycle in Kotido.

One Palestinian Red Crescent health worker in a marked ambulance was injured after being hit with a rifle by the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) in Beit Farouk locality, South of Nablus (Nablus governorate). Another health worker was also injured (injury extent unknown).
One male national INGO aid worker was kidnapped by unknown men in Port au Prince. The kidnappers have contacted the family to ask for money to release the aid worker.
Two INGO staff were kidnapped by unknown actors in Oromia. Their whereabouts are currently unknown.
One driver from an INGO was injured when the vehicle was ambushed by unknown actors close to Ngarere village, along the Camp 15 - Chukudum road, Eastern Equatoria.
Two INGO staff members were shot and injured during a road ambush by unknown extremists 20km south-west of Koutiala town.
One INGO staff member, travelling from Camp 15, was shot and injured after their vehicle was ambushed by unknown armed elements in Chukudum payam, Budi.
One senior male health worker from an INGO-supported hospital was shot dead by unknown armed men on the road connecting al-Mzayreeb town and Tafas city in Daraa.

One INGO staff member was killed and another injured by a government airstrike in Shire, Tigray. Reports indicate the aid workers were a nutrition team delivering aid to women and children during the airstrike. Other civilians were also killed (not counted here).
One national INGO driver was killed by unknown armed people in Antioquia.
Two male national UN-contracted drivers were kidnapped by unknown armed men between Kaya and Tougouri, Sanmatenga. Both drivers were released without the food trucks two days later.
One male volunteer of the Sudanese Red Crescent was killed when unknown people attacked him with knives while on duty in Lagawa, West Kordofan.
Two INGO aid workers were abducted by militants of the Islamic State in Western Africa in the village of Hourara, Ansongo, Gao. A health worker was also abducted during the incident (not counted).
Two INGO staff members were reportedly ambushed and kidnapped by unknown armed men outside of Lukongo village on the Baraka-Fizi axis. Their whereabouts is unknown.

One local staff member was taken from their compound by armed youths and seriously assaulted. The victim received treatment for their injuries at a medical facility in Leer town. This incident occurred in Mayendit County.
One male national UN worker was attacked with sticks in his neck by two unknown men while buying groceries with a colleague in Dubti, Afar.
One INGO aid worker was kidnapped along with the family in Enugu State by unknown actors. The family was released the next day, while the aid worker was released on November 7th.
One national UN moto messenger was injured by a paintball shot when crossing through the city center of Tehran during a protest surrounded by police officers.
One national male INGO aid worker was arrested and beaten by fellow inmates in Masisi, North Kivu.
One Red Cross ambulance driver transporting injured individuals from Adwa, Tigray to Amhara was killed after the marked vehicle was attacked by the military. The patients were also killed.
One national male UN aid worker was abducted by unknown armed men in Port au Prince. The aid worker was released on the 9th of November.
One male NGO staff member was shot and injured by a colleague over a beneficiary dispute in a residential area of Ikotos.
One INGO national contracted bodyguard was shot by Rohingya extremists in Bangladesh.
One male national INGO aid worker was robbed and injured in his home in Bentiu, Unity.
One male aid worker was beheaded during a riot in his village by unknown violent rioters who mistook the organisation for another group.
One UN aid worker was kidnapped and killed by suspected soldiers or volunteer fighters (VDP) in Djibo, Soum province. The body was found on the 4th of November near Bougel Sawa.
One male national INGO staff was injured when a vehicle-born IED targeting the Taliban Rural Rehabilitation and Development Ministry exploded in Afghanistan.

Two national INGO aid workers were shot and killed by unknown actors in a street in Mwenso, North Kivu. The second INGO worker was killed while assisting an administrative servant previously shot. Both of the shootings were done by the same actors.
One national male UN worker died from a missile from the Myanmar Armed Forces targeting the Arakan Army in Thayetkin Matu village, Rakhine.
One male international INGO staff was shot and killed in a reported failed kidnapping on the road outside his home in the Karrada district of Baghdad.
One NNGO wealth worker was injured in a landmine explosion while going to meet a patient near Kyar Ta Kan village, Kanbalu district, Sagaing region.
One INGO national health worker was kidnapped by JNIM militants between Bandiagara and Bakass, Mopti region. A driver and another health worker were also kidnapped and released later (not counted).
One female national UN consultant and one female national INGO worker were sexually assaulted when armed men tried to steal their personal belongings between Mendi and Nipa, Papua New Guinea.
One UN agency pilot and an INGO staff were attacked and killed by a rouge member of the Nigerian Armed Forces inside the military base in Damboa.
One NGO staff was shot and killed, one injured and a third was kidnapped for 2 days after an armed group raided a nutrition site in Biyien village.

Eight national UN drivers were kidnapped during a carjacking of a convoy of 24 trucks near Nedjo town, West Wellega. The eight drivers and the trucks were released one day later without the cargo. Four other trucks were looted.
One male INGO national staff was killed during an ambush on his way to Palma, in Cabo Delgado province. A total of five civilians were killed (not counted here).
One UN food supplier contracted truck driver was injured by a soldier at the Tharkueng checkpoint on his way to Kuajok.
One national INGO female staff was severely injured during an armed robbery in Kemb, Basse-Kotto.
One international UN worker was robbed and injured while riding a moto-taxi at night in Bamako.

One driver of the Logistics Cluster was robbed and injured by unidentified individuals while transporting supplies along the Juba-Torit Road in Lirya Payam, Juba County. The driver's personal belongings, cash, and cartons of food items were taken.
Two volunteer aid workers were abducted by JNIM Militia between Adiora and Gossi, Gourma-Rharous, Tombouctou. The workers were released on the 1 of December.

One INGO national staff was shot during an ambush by armed Nuer youths while travelling near Auya-wangeny village to Kodok Town using a canoe. The whereabouts of his family remain unclear. (Not counted).
One INGO international staff member was abducted by unknown actors in Amhara.
Four NGO staff were kidnapped by suspected JNIM militants between Kotouba and Nafadji villages, Kita commune, Kayes region. No release information is available.
One NGO security guard was abducted in Sevare, Mopti, by unidentified armed men driving an ambulance. His whereabouts is currently unknown.
One INGO staff was threatened, robbed, stabbed and injured while in transit by a criminal group in Tigray.
One UN national official was drugged with scopolamine and robbed in a taxicab in Bogot. A laptop and other valuable belongings were stolen.
One national UN-contracted female aid worker was injured during an individual attack by unknown armed people in Nampula.
One NGO health worker was killed due to an IED mine explosion detonated by motorcycles on the main road in Dogofry, Niono, Segou. Two civilians were injured in the blast.
One aid worker was killed by an unidentified Mai Mai militia in Bapwakina, Mambasa, Ituri. Another civilian was also killed in the same attack.

One national male UN aid worker was injured when a rock was thrown at the vehicle by unknown actors in Ciudad Bolvar, Bolvar. As stopping was unsafe, the staff received first aid in the car while they continued to a hospital.
One national INGO aid worker was physically attacked by a client while in the field for the loan in arrears collection.

Two national UN partner aid workers were kidnapped by the Ambazonian Defense Forces (ADF) during a food distribution in Guzan, Momo. The NSAG men alleged that the Partner staff had failed to follow through on their premises to do food distribution in Ashong FDP. The aid workers were released three days after.

One female paramedic of the Ukrainian Red Cross was killed, and two other aid workers were injured by a shelling attack in an aid distribution center in Kherson. A male civilian also died in the attack.
One logistician of an INGO was kidnapped at the compound of the organization by armed men in Gao city. The worker was released on the 23rd of December.

Three local UN contractors were stopped and harassed for several hours by the police on the demand of the Guit County Commissioner in Bentiu Town, Rubkotne Payam, Rubkona County. The driver sustained injuries, and the phones of the aid workers were confiscated.
One UN agency contracted senior guard was physically assaulted by an unidentified actor in Rumbek Town, Matangai Payam, Rumbek Center County.
Two NGO national workers were ambushed and killed by alleged Murle youth when moving from Pajut to Tiam, Duk County, Jonglei.
Six INGO aid workers were injured when unidentified actors attacked and looted them of their belongings in Koui, Ouham-Pende. The INGO suspended its activities for two weeks.

Two local bodyguards of a national NGO were killed during an armed clash in Rumamer village, Abyei, Warrap. The NGO is an implementing partner of a UN agency. A total of 14 people, including women and children, died in the attack.
Two INGO aid workers were injured when unidentified armed men attacked their convoy in Bourouba village, Ombella-MPoko. They received medical attention in Bangui.
Two INGO national aid workers were kidnapped by suspected JNIM militants near Kori Village, Mopti region. They were released 3 days later.
One UN staff member was shot and killed by burglars on the street near his home after the staff tried to respond to calls his neighbours were being robbed.
One NNGO driver was killed in a vehicle provided by a UN agency during a suspected car-jacking by Boko Haram militants in Chetuimari town, Diffa region.
One national staff of an INGO was injured in a machete attack when resisting an armed robbery in Gao City.
One NNGO contracted guard was attacked and killed by armed Murle tribesmen in Duk. An unknown quantity of food was stolen from the NGO facility.
One national NGO aid worker was injured by a gunshot from armed Murle youth along the Lankien-Waat Road in Waat area, Nyirol County.

One national NGO staff was killed and another was injured while assisting the victims of a raid conducted by Murle youths in Walgat town, Nyirol, Jonglei. Both staff were off-duty at the time of the incident and were assisting community members as civilians.

One international male aid worker and one international female aid worker (Polish) were injured when a mortar bomb exploded next to them while unloading humanitarian aid from their vehicle in the Bakhmut front, Donetsk Oblast. Both of them were transported to their country of origin, and the woman suffered an amputation.
One national INGO security guard was injured by a stray bullet from a clash between Murle tribesman and local youth of the Mwot Tot area in Uror County.

Actor name: Islamic State in the Greater Sahara
Details: One national INGO was injured during an attack by the Islamic State in the Greater Sahara (ISGS) in Inagam village, in Menaka, Gao region.
One national NGO aid worker was killed at his house during a wider attack by bandits in Ungawar Mai Awo village, Kaduna. His nephew was also killed.
One UN staff aid worker was injured when four criminal actors attempted to rob his personal cellphone using knives at his house in Kigali.
One INGO contractor was shot and killed by unknown armed actors while travelling in Central Darfur.
One national NGO worker was injured when unknown armed men raided the organisation compound in Pibor, Jonglei. The attackers targeted the NGO looking for cash and other assets to be stolen.
One NNGO aid worker was injured after stepping on an anti-personnel mine in Tumaco, Nario.
One UN agency doctor was kidnapped by unknown armed actors in Menaka, Gao. The doctor was released on February 2.

Two personnel from an INGO were wounded during a strike from the Russian Federation forces while traveling from Kharkiv to Lyptsi village. Allegedly the strike was targeting a checkpoint near the Russian border.
Two national NGO workers were injured when unknown armed actors raided their compound and stole a mobile phone.

One national NGO contractor was killed and another staff injured by unidentified gunmen in the Giessan area, Blue Nile region. According to the government, the Sudan People's Liberation Movement-North were responsible.
One security guard at an NGO-supported health centre was killed by three unknown men using bladed weapons in Lummuri village, Kupera Payam, Lainya County.

One international country director of an INGO was killed, two national and two international INGO aid workers were injured when a missile hit an ambulance they were evacuating in Bakhmut, Donetsk Oblast.

Four national off-duty Red Cross Society aid workers were killed during an attack from suspected armed Dinka Bor on the host communities of Mogiri, Lekamerrok, Kudaz of Lire Payam in Kajo Keji. Official reports indicate the aid workers were targeted due to their ethnicity, unrelated to their work with the Red Cross.
One national INGO driver was shot and killed by a non-state armed group while going to visit his family by public transportation on his day off in Pemba, Cabo Delgado.
One INGO national staff guard was shot and killed outside the INGO office in Kutupalong Refugee Camp (2w). Reasons unknown at this time.

Two INGO aid workers were killed when unknown gunmen fired their vehicle between Dedougou and Tougan, Boucle du Mouhoun region. Two other aid workers managed to escape. The INGO suspended activities in the region.
One INGO aid worker was injured when a group of criminals attacked and robbed him at a public bus stop in Oromiya.
One INGO aid worker was injured by four criminals who took his personal belongings in Shire, Tigray.
One male first aid instructor volunteer from the Somali Red Crescent was killed by a stray bullet in Lasanod, Sool, Somaliland.
One local INGO male worked was injured during an assault by unidentified men on the way to Boma hospital. Another female national aid worker was also assaulted but did not suffer injuries.
One national NGO driver was injured when his ambulance was shot at while returning from the hospital in Mandalay town to Let Pan Hla village.

One community health worker from an INGO-supported health facility was assaulted and injured by a patient over a dispute regarding the expiration date of a Covid-19 vaccine in Maat village, Alam Payam, Pigi County.
One national NGO worked was injured when an airstrike hit the organisation's warehouse in Kherson city.

One aid worker was murdered and five other aid workers are missing after an attack by unknown actors on an INGO-contracted boat transporting humanitarian supplies from Juba County to Panyijiar County, close to Nyori village.
One national NGO driver was shot and killed at a teashop by unknown armed men in Xiniinyo Warsangeli area, Bari region.
One UN national staff was stabbed during a robbery while he was walking to catch a taxi in Kabul.

One female INGO national staff was assaulted and taken to an isolated area in Pibor town by an alleged Lango age-set group where she was injured. The woman managed to escape and was medically evacuated.
One national INGO worker was killed by Murle Tribesman near a nutrition project site, in Duk Pagaak, Duk County.
One INGO-contracted driver and his assistant were injured when their vehicle carrying commodities was ambushed and shot by unknown armed people along Gadiang - Yuai road, in Payuel Payam, Duk County.
One NNGO director was kidnapped by an unknown group in Magway while travelling. He was held for 20 days.
Two ICRC aid workers were kidnapped by unknown actors between Gao and Kidal, Gao region. The aid workers were released on the 19th of March.

One national NGO aid worker was injured by unknown armed actors during a violent robbery near the Meteorology Station in Bissau when returning home after a night out. Three UN mission staff were also robbed (not counted).
One INGO staff member was shot in the leg while standing in front of the office building in Dinsoor, Bay region. He was taken for medical treatment and has since almost fully recovered.
Two INGO aid workers were ambushed and kidnapped by unknown actors when returning from a food distribution in Kikonde, Fizi, South Kivu.
One male national UN aid worker was kidnapped at his house by unknown actors in Port Au Prince for economic purposes. The aid worker was released on March 14th.

One international volunteer and one national were wounded when a Russian rocket hit a minibus carrying humanitarian aid travelling from Bakhmut to the city of Chasiv Yar, Donetsk Oblast. The international staff died from their injuries on March 27.

Two UN-contracted drivers were hit by gunshots when five trucks were left behind from a big convoy and later ambushed by armed Murle Tribesmen in the Thiam area, Duk county. One contracted was killed and the other seriously injured.

One aid worker was killed, one wounded, and two drivers are missing when four commercial UN-contracted trucks were attacked by armed Murle Tribesmen when returning from the Greater Pibor Area to Bor Town, Jonglei.
One international contracted UN truck driver was shot dead when reportedly Murle Tribesmen ambushed a convoy of 6 trucks who had delivered food in Gumuruk county.
One national UN aid worker was assaulted and injured by criminals in his home in Torit, Eastern Equatoria.
One off-duty national INGO aid worker was injured during a robbery by unknown criminals at the compound in Bentiu IDP camp.
One national UN aid worker was injured when a group of IDPs allegedly pelted him with stones while on duty in Malakal, Upper Nile.
One INGO driver was injured after a physical altercation with an unknown individual in Raqqa.

One UN contractor driver was shot and wounded and another UN-contracted driver went missing when their vehicles were reportedly ambushed by unknown armed men along the Yuai-Gadinag in Payuel Payam, Duk County. The convoy reportedly left behind an escort from the UN Force Protection that was to escort the vehicles back to Bor.

One UN agency local contractor was reportedly, ambushed, assaulted, and robbed of personal belongings by suspected men from Panyuon section of the Agaar Dinka community, along the Puornengdit-Rumbek Road in Toch Area, Amongpiny Payam, Rumbek Centre County.
One male locally recruited NGO staff member was abducted and tortured to death by a group of armed youth in Malual Gahoth Boma of Malual Payam.
One male national INGO aid worker was injured by a stray bullet during crossfire in Cite Soleil, Port au Prince.
One national INGO contractor was injured by the intoxicated partner of an aid recipient with a machete while doing home visits in Jocotan, Chiquimula.
One aid worker was killed in the conflict sometime between April to June in Khartoum, Sudan.

One national Palestinian Red Crescent Society aid worker was seriously injured when the Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) attacked his ambulance and an Emergency Medical Technician (EMT) stationed at the Bab Al-Asbat area, near Al-Aqsa Mosque. In addition, the Israel Defence Forces (IDF) shot a sound bomb at the ambulance, breaking the mirror on the driver's side.
Three drivers in UN-contracted vehicles were ambushed and injured by unknown actors while moving in a convoy from Yuai to Bor along the Gadiang-Bor Road in Payuel Payam, Duk County.
One national female UN polio vaccination worker was shot dead by unknown actors in Mogadishu while going house to house informing about the polio vaccination campaign.
One ambulance driver and one mid-wife from the Ethiopian Red Cross were shot and injured when unknown armed men attacked their ambulance in Abscia, Amhara region.

Two INGO national staff members were shot and killed in a crossfire between the Ethiopian Federal Defence Forces (ENDF) and Amhara Regional Special Forces in Kobo, Amhara region. The driver and the security officer were traveling from Mekelle to Kombolcha.
One national female INGO worker was killed in North Kivu. The aid worker was off duty, on her way to a voting registration centre.

One national INGO staff was shot dead when unknown men attacked a commercial vehicle carrying goats along Kapoeta-Camp 15 Road. The body of the aid worker was found naked nearby. Two other civilians sustained gunshot wounds.
One INGO staff member sustained serious injuries during a multi family dispute.
One donor government official was shot and wounded during clashes between the Sudanese Armed Forces and the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Khartoum.

Three UN employees were killed and three injured in clashes between the Sudanese Army and the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Kabkabiya, North Darfur. The incident caused the temporary suspension of operations of the organization.
One national male INGO worker was killed in the ongoing clashes between the Sudanese Armed Forces (SAF) and the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in North Darfur.
One INGO aid worker was reportedly sexually assaulted by unidentified perpetrators in Khartoum.
One UN national staff was shot and injured when Rapid Support Forces entered his house and looted it in Amarat, Khartoum. The RSP fired other gunshots and stole mobile phones.
One UN male national staff was injured due to a projectile explosion during clashes between the Sudanese Armed Forces and the Rapid Support Forces in Zalingi, Central Darfur.
One off-duty national UN aid worker was injured when criminals entered his family house, threatened him and asked for his money in Bo, Southern.
One UN staff member was injured by shrapnel after his house was hit by shelling in El Obied.
One male national UN staff was killed when the vehicle he was traveling with his family was caught in a crossfire between confronted parties in El Obeid, North Kordofan.

One male national INGO aid worker was assaulted and injured when unknown individuals entered his home and attacked him while he was sleeping. The reason for the attack was reportedly revenge motivated.
One male UN aid worker was kidnapped by the Rapid Support Forces in Khartoum. The aid worker was released 21 days later.
One national UN guard was kidnapped by unknown armed actors during a raid on the agency's facilities in Benisheik, Borno State. His whereabouts remain unknown.
Two UN contracted drivers, one on duty and one off duty, were attacked by gunmen travelling in Oromia and injured.

Three national INGO aid workers were abducted at their guest house by a group of militants of the Islamic State in West Africa (ISWA) in Ngala, Borno State. On May 4th, two of the three aid workers were found unharmed by the Nigerian Armed Forces.

One UN agency contracted driver was killed during a road ambush by unidentified armed individuals on the Ajakkuac-Abiemnhom road at the Ariel Zain Tower, Abiemnhom County. Two other drivers were robbed but not harmed.

One on-duty NGO security guard was assaulted, injured, and locked up in a room inside the NGO facility compound by three unknown armed men who gained illegal access in the Gendrassa area, Boung Payam, Maban County.
Two NNGO contracted drivers were attacked by an armed group who lit their vehicle on fire. One driver was killed and the other was seriously injured.
One local male INGO staff was killed while off-duty by unidentified perpetrators in Ag Geneina city, West Darfur state.
Two aid workers were killed in Ag Geneina by unknown actors at the end of May.
One INGO staff member sustained a head injury from a physical attack by an unknown man in Damaturu town.
One female national INGO staff was sexually assaulted by another staff member at a project site in Malakal.
One INGO staff member was killed when his private vehicle came under fire during an violent operation between two different NSAGs.
One UN contracted driver was injured, taken to an unknown location, and later dropped off in a remote area when unknown armed men intercepted the vehicle in Al Sumayah IDP camp, Ma'rib governorate.
One male national INGO aid worker was injured by a stray bullet during a crossfire in Portail Leogane, Port au Prince.
One female staff was injured during an attempted rape at a hotel in Koui by PMC Wagner Group soliders.

Two INGO aid workers were injured when a group of unknown youths attacked their ambulance in Burato area, Jonglei. One former health minister from the Greater Pibor Area was also injured during the attack (not counted).
One INGO aid worker was injured at home due to nearby explosives.
One national INGO aid worker was killed in his home by three armed youths in Ulang, Upper Nile. Allegedly, the motive was related to a revenge killing.
One female national UN aid worker was shot and killed by unknown armed men in Masemu. Another civilian (non-UN driver) was also killed during the shooting (not counted).
One national INGO aid worker was killed by unknown armed actors in Zalingi, Central Darfur.
The body of a national NGO staff member was found with stab wounds near Yad village.
One female international INGO aid worker was sexually assaulted in her home in Kapoeta, Eastern Equatoria.
One INGO aid worker was killed in Nyala, South Darfur.
One national INGO aid worker was injured by a stray bullet at the organisation's compound in Mueda.

One national INGO driver was killed by unidentified perpetrators during an ambush in Birao, Vakaga region. Two other INGO workers managed to escape, and the vehicle was taken to an unknown location, but was later found.

One national INGO aid worker was shot and killed, and two national INGO aid workers were injured with sticks when 10 Murle Tribesman of the Kurenen age-set ambushed them between Pibor Town and Tenet Village.
Two national UN staff were physically assaulted by the South Sudan Defence Forces (SSDF) after being detained in Pageri Payam, Magwi County. The aid workers were released the same day.

Actor name: Islamic State of West Africa Province
Details: One NGO worker was killed by Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) members in Damasak, Borno State.

One national UN male aid worker was beaten and injured with electric shocks by a group of armed personnel wearing the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) uniform, after intruding into the UN worker's residence in Zalingi, and started questioning the identity of the staff member. Later the perpetrators started searching and damaging the house and looted unspecified items. One civilian who was present in the house was also injured (not counted).
One male national Sudanese Red Crescent aid worker was killed due to a shelling attack that hit his house in Gabra, in south Khartoum.
Three INGO national staff members were injured by suspected armed individuals from Ikotos County while traveling to deliver seeds to farmers in Chukudum, in Komori Payam, Budi County.
One NNGO bulldozer driver was injured when a landmine exploded while working in Afrin, Aleppo.

Five NGO staff members were kidnapped by Al Shabaab militants on the road between Farlibah village and Beledweyne, around Morodiile, Hiraan. They were all released over a week later after a ransom demand.
One national INGO aid worker was seriously injured during an incursion to his home by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Omdurman, Khartoum.
One national male INGO aid worker was killed by unknown armed men while off duty in Ag Geneina.
One national INGO aid worker was stabbed to death by unknown actors in Renk, Upper Nile.
One national male INGO aid worker was injured during a robbery by unknown criminals on the Magburaka highway, Nothern province.
One nationally recruited INGO aid worker was stabbed to death by unknown armed actors in Renk town, Upper Nile.
One national NGO worker was abducted by suspected JNIM militia men in Niangassagou village, Mopti.

One UN female aid worker was killed during a siege by Al Shabaab members in Lido Beach, Mogadishu. Eight other people were killed, and 10 were injured, including members of the Somali security forces and civilians.
The founder of an NNGO was killed by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) and Janjaweed militias in Ag Geneina, West Darfur.

The head of a NNGO was kidnapped by unknown armed men while travelling by motorbike to Lusenda, Fizi territory. Allegedly, the kidnapping occurred following a disagreement on a road project and the perpetrators asked for a ransom. His travel companion was also kidnapped and tortured but released a few hours later (not counted). The aid worker was released on June 17th after the ransom was paid.
One aid worker was killed in Central Darfur.
One NNGO contracted driver was shot and killed by unknown armed men as he was trying to get his truck unstuck from a river near Charokol village, Ikotos.
One male UN agency local national staff member and one female local national aid worker were physically assaulted by a local person in Marol Market, Makuach Payam, Bor South County.
One national INGO security guard was killed at his home, along with his family by a shelling attack in Khartoum.
One UN staff member was killed as him and his family were evacuating near the Chad border.
One aid worker and one driver from an INGO were injured when an aid recipient threw stones and broke the doors of the car they were in, in Babati, Manyara.
Two national NGO contractors and the driver were kidnapped by Al Shabaab near Bansoole village, Buur Hakaba, Bay due to their NGO affiliation.
An INGO female national staff was injured after an unknown person threw a stone at their vehicle breaking the glass in Mahagi.
One INGO aid worker was killed by angry workers when trying to mediate over a wage dispute in Gazipur, Dhaka.
One female INGO aid worker was injured by two criminals on a motorcycle who robbed her personal belongings in Madale village, Kinondoni, Dar Es Salaam.
One female national UN worker was kidnapped by unknown actors in Taraba. Her whereabouts remain unknown.
One national NGO aid worker was killed by unidentified armed men in Beni city, North Kivu province.
One female NGO aid worker was reportedly injured during Russian shelling near Makiivka.
One national UN aid worker was injured during a criminal robbery of his residence in Mvolo Payam.
One national UN aid worker was kidnapped while off-duty by criminal actors on the road between Fort Liberte and Montruis, in Les Gonaves, Artibonite. The aid worker was released on July 6th.
One NGO consultant was kidnapped by JNIM militants along with a vehicle in Bintagoungou village, Tombouctou region.
One INGO driver was kidnapped by criminal actors in Delmas. His whereabouts remain unknown.
5 healthcare staff supported by an INGO, at the Las Anod General Hospital were injured due to shelling.
One national NGO aid worker was killed by shelling from the Syrian Armed Forces in Atareb, Aleppo.
One INGO national staff member was assaulted and injured for unknown reasons by a FACA soldier in Kaga-Bandoro. The perpetrator later harassed the family of the victim.
One INGO contractor driver was kidnapped while driving from Port-au-Prince to Gonaive in a rental vehicle. His whereabouts are unknown.

One UN agency international staff member was injured when a local juvenile reportedly attempted to steal a UN jacket in Wau Town, Wau South Payam, Wau County. They received medical attention at a UNMISS hospital.
One INGO aid worker was stabbed and injured by criminal actors on his way home in Oromiya. His personal belongings were stolen during the incident.
Two national NGO aid workers were killed by unknown actors in the Afar region.
One national NGO aid worker was killed by unknown actors in Amhara.

18 INGO aid workers were physically beaten and whipped by unknown armed men in southern Khartoum while attempting to bring supplies to a hospital. The armed men also threaten the life of the driver and stole a vehicle.
One international UN aid worker was shot and killed while leaving a restaurant in Turbah, Aden, by unknown armed men on a motorcycle.
One INGO driver was injured when unknown armed men opened fire on the vehicle he was driving near Dhobley town, Afmadow, Lower Juba.
One national male UN aid worker was kidnapped for economic purposes by unknown criminals in Port au Prince. The aid worker was released on September 2nd.
One UN IDP staff member was stabbed by a member of the 'One Heart' gang in IDP Camp 3 near the UN House compound.
One national NGO aid worker was beaten during an ambush on their vehicle traveling from Gumuruk to Pibor, Jonglei.
One Palestinian Red Crescent Society medical staff was shot and injured by the Israel Defence Forces while on duty in Askar Camp.
One female international NNGO aid worker was kidnapped with her child at the project site of the organization in Port au Prince. The nurse and her child were released on the 9th of August.

One INGO staff member was kidnapped in the hospital area of 'Camp 3', Cox's Bazar, by an unknown armed group. He was asked to join the group, and was beaten when refused. He was reportedly released after a ransom payment was made.

One UN staff member was injured during the clashes between Jund al-Sham, Shabab al Muslim and Fatah in Ain al-Hilweh refugee camp. The confrontations killed at least 13 people and injured around 40 (not counted). The UN agency temporarily suspended its activities in the camp.
One doctor was killed and five medical staff were wounded when an INGO-supported hospital was shelled two times by the Russian Armed Forces in Kherson city, Kherson Oblast.
One male national INGO staff was kidnapped from his home in Nyala and later killed.
One national NNGO contractor was abducted by JNIM militiamen along with a vehicle in Bintagoungou, Goundam, Tombouctou. His whereabouts remain unknown.
One national NGO staff was kidnapped along with two vehicles by JNIM Militia in Niafounke, Tombouctou. His whereabouts remain unknown.

One male INGO aid worker was physically assaulted by soldiers from the Somali Armed Forces after refusing to add them to the list of beneficiaries at the Jakaton IDP camp, in Baidoa. The program was temporarily suspended due to the incident.
One INGO male national staff member was injured when an unknown person threw a stone at their vehicle breaking the glass in Djugu.
One national aid worker was shot and wounded by unknown armed men in Dori, Sahel region.
Three NGO aid workers were injured when their ambulance was hit by mortar rounds during a combat between the Dhulbahante clan and the Somaliland security forces.
One national NGO driver was abducted when the Dulmi-diid clan militia entered Daba Goryaale village and carjacked two NGO-owned vehicles in the Togdheer region. His whereabouts remain unknown.
Three INGO aid workers were abducted by unknown armed men in Mushegereza, Uvira, South Kivu. The victims were released on August 14th.
One INGO staff member was kidnapped by RSF forces and forced to work in a RSF military medical facility in Khartoum.
One male president of an LNGO was shot dead by unknown armed men while sitting in front of his office in Pyin Oo Lwin, Mandalay.
One UN staff member, off-duty and at home, was kidnapped by unknown armed for ransom in Beledweyne, Hiraan. He was held for more than 24 hours, but released unharmed.

One UN aid worker was wounded by Tariq Saleh's forces in an aid distribution centre in Al Khawkhah, Al Hodeidah. The attack occurred because of the organisation's refusal to include the names of some people of the armed factions.
