One NRCS paramedic was injured when an ambulance was attacked with grenades by allegedly the IDF militants in Beita town, Nablus, West Bank.
One NNGO aid worker was kidnapped by the RSF in Khartoum. The whereabouts of the aid worker remain unknown.
Two NNGO aid workers were kidnapped by the RSF at the Bashair Teaching Hospital in southern Khartoum. Their whereabouts remain unknown.
Two security guards of an INGO implementing partner were shot and killed when armed criminals robbed the INGO distribution point in Mowt Tot, Uror, Jonglei.

At least one INGO aid worker was beaten and injured when the Taliban forces forcibly entered the INGO's Kandahar office, demanding the cessation of all its aid activities across the country and the expulsion of its personnel. Sources said the motive was the organization's recent staff reductions, including the dismissal of Taliban-appointed relatives and members, following USAID defunding.
One NRCS health worker was abducted by allegedly Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) members at a health facility in Azam Warsak, South Waziristan. The reason for the abduction was economic.
Two aid workers were killed by unknown armed men in the ZamZam refugee camp, Al Fasher, North Darfur.
One UN-contracted aid worker was killed during a shelling that hit his home in Al Fasher, North Darfur.
One INGO aid worker was shot when bullets from a confrontation between M-23 and VDP/Wazalendo hit the INGO warehouse. The aid worker later died due to the injuries.

Actor name: Islamic State of West Africa Province
Details: Two INGO aid workers were abducted by the ISWAP during a raid in Monguno, Borno. Their whereabouts remain unknown.

According to UN agency reports, an additional 8 UN agency staff members were killed in the Gaza Strip between March 1st and March 28th, 2025. Further information on their exact whereabouts or the means of attack is unknown at this time.
One INGO aid worker was injured when unknown armed men ambushed the organisation's vehicle in Lekuangole, Pibor, Jonglei.
One UN aid worker was shot and killed when caught in a crossfire in Jableh, driving to Latakia, Latakia governorate.
One on-duty NNGO aid worker was killed when a shell hit in Dobropillya, Pokrovsk, Donetsk oblast. Ten other people were also killed and 47 were injured (not counted).
One NRCS aid worker was shot and killed by allegedly CODECO members in the Djangapoli mining area, Djugu, Ituri.
One NNGO aid worker was killed by the Rapid Support Forces in Al Jarif West, Khartoum.
Eight on-duty INGO aid workers were killed during an airstrike in Beit Lahia, Gaza.
One INGO aid worker was shot and killed by unknown armed actors in Ameth-Chok village, Tonj South, Warrap.
At least two on-duty NRCS aid workers were severely beaten and injured by the IDF in Odla, Nablus, West Bank.

City: Between Port au Prince and Delmas
Details: Two NNGO aid workers were kidnapped by unknown actors while on their way to the airport in Port au Prince. The aid workers were released three days later. The NNGO suspended operations in the capital due to the incident.
One national INGO aid worker was killed during an airstrike that hit his apartment in Deir al-Balah, Gaza Strip.

One international UN aid worker was killed and five other nationals were injured when IDF tank shells detonated inside a UN building in Deir al Balah, Gaza Strip. Reports indicate the location was officially deconflicted with all parties to the conflict. The UN is significantly reducing international staff in the area due to safety concerns.
One UN aid worker was robbed and injured by criminals in Aweil, Northern Bahr el Gazhal.
One NNGO aid worker was killed during an airstrike in Jikmir, Nasir, Upper Nile. The exact number of casualties is unknown.
Eight NRCS aid workers and one UN aid worker were found dead in a mass grave after having been attacked while on duty in Rafah, Gaza Strip. One NRCS aid worker is still missing.
One male INGO aid worker was killed when the project site was hit in Gaza. Six other civilians were injured during the attack (not counted).
One male INGO aid worker was killed when an airstrike hit his home in Deir al Balah, Gaza. His wife and daughter were also killed during the incident (not counted).
One NGO aid worker was injured when an armoured humanitarian vehicle was attacked by a drone during an evacuation in Kherson city, Kherson oblast.

9 INGO health clinic national staff were killed by Rapid Support Forces (RSF) fighters who raided the Zamzam Refugee camp in Darfur. Official reports indicate the organisation's clinic alongside other camp structures and services was specifically targeted by the perpetrators.
